text:
Hi guys!
I'm having some issues with HubSpot's validation of an autocomplete form made using jQuery UI. In the example below, the Hotel Name returns data from an endpoint with a City and Country type.
The issue I'm having is when you type a name into the Hotel Name field, eg. _Hotel_, and you select a hotel from the dropdown, it autopopulates the City and Country fields as expected, however, it still set to `false` in HubSpot's validation (see screengrab)
How do I get round this problem as the user is unable to submit the form unless they change the Country manually in the select box?

URL: <https://preview.hs-sites.com/_hcms/preview/template/multi?is_buffered_template_layout=true&portalId=3988515&tc_deviceCategory=undefined&template_layout_id=5799802055&updated=1527642830259>
hi, I have a question about old "Edit post template"/"Edit listing template" functionality. Â¿How can I edit theese templates in the new editor?  thanks in advance
<@U401USQPP> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U401USQPP/FAY7DQT0C/image.png|:sweat: I have found it>
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
What are the correct permissions for a custom API integration with HS ? Does it depend on what the integration needs to do?
Hi all, a quick update that A/B Testing Website pages is now live for all Professional and Enterprise users! <https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/in-beta-a/b-test-web-pages>
+1... HubSpot needs better regex support in general. COS Redirect tool, I'm looking at you!
Try changing "$(".hs_country select").val(country);" to $(".hs_country select").val(country).change();". Often HubSpot's validation code relies on change events being explicitly triggered.
